author: Island Smile
name: Sri Lankan Chicken And Potato Curry
ingredients:
• 500g of potatoes

  • 700g of chicken, chopped

  • 0.5 tsp of turmeric powder


Tempering ingredients

  • 3 tbsp of oil

  • 2 medium-sized onions, chopped fine

  • 2 tbsp of ginger-garlic paste

  • 2 green chillies, split in the middle

  • 2 inch cinnamon

  • 3 cardamom pods

  • 2 bay leaves

  • 1 star anise


Ingredients to cook the chicken potato curry

  • 0.5 tsp turmeric powder

  • 1 tsp red chilli powder

  • 1 tbsp of curry powder

  • 2 tsp fresh black pepper

  • Salt to season

  • 250ml of water

  • 125ml coconut milk
instructions:
• Clean and cut the chicken to the required size.

  • Make sure you cut the chicken parts slightly larger than the potatoes.

  • Once they are cut, season with salt and a pinch of turmeric.

  • Set aside till it's time to add them to the cooking spice mix.


  • Scrub, wash and place the potatoes in a pot, add water until the potatoes are completely

  • submerged.

  • Bring them to a boil, then reduce to medium heat and continue to simmer the potatoes.

  • Once par-boiled, let them cool or peel them under running water and set them aside.

  • Cut each potato into four large chunks and make sure all the potatoes are cut the same size.


  • Place a large pan over medium heat and pour in the oil.

  • Add the sliced onions, ginger-garlic paste, cinnamon, cardamom, green chilli, and sauté the

  • ingredients for 3 minutes.

  • Add the star anise, bay leaves to the pan and continue to sauté until the onions turn soft and translucent.


  • Reduce heat to low and add turmeric, chilli powder, curry powder, black pepper.

  • Combine all ingredients with the cooked spices.

  • Add the chicken parts into the cooking spices, combine and then spread the chicken parts evenly in the pan.

  • Make sure you let each side of the chicken slightly brown before turning them over.

  • Continue cooking and browning the chicken over reduced heat so as not to burn the spices, 15-20 minutes.


  • While the chicken semi-fries over a reduced heat, add the potatoes into the pan, combine and cook

  • with the chicken for 10 minutes over a low-medium fire.

  • Season with salt.

  • Pour in the water and cook until water is reduced.

  • Pour the coconut milk, add extra pepper if you need it and continue to cook until you have a thick gravy.
